snippet: Amid uncertainty about the future of the team’s ownership, the Bills lost to the Giants on Sunday, Buffalo’s first game since the death of the founding owner Ralph Wilson in March.
abstract: New York Giants defeat Buffalo Bills, 17-13, in Hall of Fame game in Canton, Ohio, that is Bills' first game since death of founding owner Ralph Wilson in March 2014; rock star Jon Bon Jovi is among the reported potential bidders trying to buy the Bills.
lead_paragraph: Amid uncertainty about the future of the team’s ownership, the Bills lost to the Giants on Sunday, Buffalo’s first game since the death of the founding owner Ralph Wilson in March.

headline.main: Jittery About Team’s Future, Bills Fans Remember a Titan of Its Past
headline.print_headline: Jittery About Team’s Future, Bills Fans Remember a Titan of Its Past
